p: Dichloromethane extract of E. abyssinica stem bark was observed to exhibit high antiplasmodial activity (IC 50 < 10 μg/ml) in this study while both water and methanol extracts were moderately active (IC 50 of 11-50) against both chloroquine-sensitive (D6) and chloroquine-resistance (W2) strains of P. falciparum. However, although none of E. abyssinica extract was highly active in vivo (suppression of >60%), the dichloromethane extracts exhibited a moderate suppression of 38.85% ( Table 3). These findings concur with previous studies by [ 21] who reported high activity for the less polar ethyl acetate extracts.
